newsitem.title: USA: United Petroleum debt converted to stock.
newsitem.headline: United Petroleum debt converted to stock.

text.p: United Petroleum Corp said Thursday its holders of convertible debentures had agreed to convert $8.78 million in debt to stock.
The company said in a statement that under the accord convertible debenture holders had converted about $8.78 million of their debentures to a newly created Class "A" convertible preferred stock.
They have substituted amended convertible debentures for the balance of the original debentures with a face amount of $20.8 million. The agreement took effect April 30.

"This agreement results in substantial improvement in the company's balance sheet by increasing equity to approximately $12.2 million while reducing debt to approximately $13.7 million as of March 31, 1997 as compared to approximately $22.2 million as of Dec 31, 1996," the statement said.
